amendment.description: Amendment increases funding for rural development programs by $1 billion over 10 years.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 15 printed in the Congressional Record to increase funding for rural strategic planning initiatives by $45 million annually; community water assistance grants by $45 million annually; and value-added agricultural product market development grants by $10 million annually.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Clayton amendment (A032) Agreed to by recorded vote: 235 - 183 (Roll no. 369).
